condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased understanding, capacity and commitment of key businesses and strategic partners towards corporate responsibility to respect and support for children’s rights.

description.narrative: The Children's Rights and Business (CRB) unit has advocated successfully for the inclusion of children's rights in Thailand's NAP, engaged the Thai Construction Association leading to its declaration to end child labour practices and support children living on construction sites as well as supporting local NGOs demonstrate pilot camps and gather evidence for regulation change. It has also collaborated with the Sustainable Development section at the Stock Exchange of Thailand to organize a Children's Rights and Business workshop for listed companies to understand their impact and design remediation to mitigate the effects. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Extent to which construction companies provide services and protection to children of migrant workers: Level 1:At least 3 construction companies have committed in writing to the Chiang Mai framework for action Level 2: At least 3 construction companies are implementing the Chiang Mai framework of action in at least 25% of their construction sites and related construction camps Level 3: At least 3 construction companies are implementing the Chiang Mai framework of action in at least 100% of their

Number of business engage in the adoption and implementation of family friendly workplaces Level 1: The benefit of implementation of family friendly workplace is being reached out Level 2: Participate in UNICEF-supported Government-led co-ordination on the benefit of family friendly workplace Level 3: Business support and inform the Human resource the knowledge regarding the benefit Level 4: Adopting and implementation of family friendly workplace

Engagement from the private sector in the development of skills and employability for youth through Generation Unlimited initiative Level 1: Private sector support/amplify Generation Unlimited messages and initiatives Level 2: targeted private sector supports ADAP

target.value: 2021:Level 2: 5 companies for TDRI and 5 companies from DJOP research

title.narrative: Corporate employee engagement in UNICEF's programme and advocacy priority areas such as ending violence and youth employability piloted.
Number of key business stakeholders engaged by UNICEF that publicly commit to respecting children
